summary: In FY 2022, the Department of Transportation's RAISE program awarded about $2.25 billion to transportation projects. As part of the RAISE application, DOT required capital grant applicants to analyze the costs and benefits of their projects. According to our survey, 69% of applicants found this analysis challenging. DOT provided some cost-benefit analysis resources in 2022, but it hasn't reviewed whether more resources are needed. We...
title: Discretionary Transportation Grants: DOT Should Better Align Its Application Evaluation Process with Federal Guidance
